column4: Cenergist is operating as an energy and water efficiency company, specialized in LED lighting, water efficiency and heating and boiler management. Services offered include advisory services like asset survey & strategies, full turn-key delivery solution, implementation of legislative requirements & updates; obtaining funding for our clients; monitoring and others services. Products portfolio offered includes showersmart, boiler management unit, and HL2024 inline flow regulator, and LED lights. Project portfolio includes water solution projects for Hackney Homes, Best Western Hotel, & German Housing Association; Consultancy & delivery projects for Wythenshawe, Tribe Apartments, Sharston Energy Works, Maritime Apartments, & London Borough of Hackney; and energy reduction projects for Bupa Care Home, Hornsey Housing Trust, & many others. Clientele included United utility, Hetiowatt University, Best Western, BUPA, and many others.

column4: Hero Labs has developed Sonic which is an Internet of Things enabled solution that detects, prevents, and stops water leaks in homes and businesses. The device can be fitted under the sink and uses ultrasonic technology to monitor water use and spot anything unusual, leveraging artificial algorithms, such as a slow dripping tap, a burst water pipe, among others. It is battery powered and comes with a proprietary radio technology that enables the same to penetrate as many as eight concrete floors thereby allowing it to be installed in basements or other difficult to access spaces where there is no WiFi signal. Sonic sends an alert via the companion application and claims to automatically shut off the water supply to prevent a leak damaging possessions and property. The company provides an optional assist service that comes with human-based monitoring center and 24/7 emergency assistance.

column4: Smartcosa provides smart devices for boiler and air conditioning control. The smart devices are cosa smart room thermostat wireless combi control and radiator control. Wireless combi control consists of two devices. One is combi smart thermostat and the other is the combi control wireless unit. Combi control wireless unit directly connect into the boiler and directly to wireless internet. The thermostat is battery-equipped and placed where the home temperature can be accurately measured. This device communicates directly to the control unit through the wireless network. Cosa radiator consists of two devices, one is cosa radiator smart radiator valve and the other is cosa internet bridge. Cosa internet-bridge communicates with the valves wirelessly and allows the valves to connect to the internet. Up to 6 valves can be matched with cosa internet bridge and the user can control the temperature through the mobile application remotely.

The company claims that the battery (version 2 under development) is made out of water and table salt, thus removing the need of harmful and toxic chemicals. column4: Atawey provides turnkey power supply systems for isolated sites, based on hydrogen technology that is adapted for tropical or temperate housing and for industrial uses. The company provides two forms of the solution, one for short term storage system with batteries, and another for long term storage system with a hydrogen chain. It has two different modes of operation, first during periods of high energy production when the system stores all the generated renewable energy in batteries. When these batteries are full, the excess energy is converted into hydrogen by electrolysis, then securely stored at low pressure and in large quantities for several months. Secondly, during periods of low energy production when demand is high and the generation from a renewable resource is low, the energy is restored via a fuel cell.
column5: On-site energy storage for behind-the-meter use

column4: Bodytrak has developed an unobtrusive body monitoring solution for enterprises operating in the industrial health and safety, defense and first responder markets. The solution comprises of an in-ear device and a SaaS platform. The in-ear device is capable of measuring key vital sign parameters including body temperature, heart rate, VO2, motion, to name a few and sends the same continuously, in real-time, to the cloud-based analytics platform. It also features two-way audio communication and ambient sound transparency for allowing users to communicate with team members or a third-party in a distant location. The platform uses proprietary algorithms and machine learning for providing health and wellbeing alerts to enable early intervention and reduce the likelihood of injury. Partners and Clients include 2iC, Formula 1, DSTL, Breed Reply, among others. As of December 2018, the solution is in the development phase but users can sign up on the website to get early access.

column4: Northstar Robotics is developing robots, retrofit kits and cloud based software platform for making on field robotic equipment autonomous. It replaces the human intervention of remote control of field equipment by introducing its scripts in all the equipment that has access to the internet through a web browser. The user can open its web app in the equipment's browser and upload precision agriculture scripts, field maps, etc., define paths and the platform's scripts can automate the entire operation. The platform can also be used to do remote sensing and field mapping. The company also develops tailored hardware for remote control or automation of an equipment that does not have access to the internet. The platform can be used to impart autonomous navigation in drones, partner robots, farm equipment or other OEM robots.

It comes with ground protection and it communicates with the other charging stations, the cars, the users and the power grid. Apart from this the product is also certified for outdoor use (IP54) and has a built in payment mechanism based on power consumed and not by the hour. There is also a portable version available. column5: Cumulus Energy is developing a rechargeable Copper/Zinc battery which has the capacity to scale up massively for providing grid level storage. The company has used existing battery storage technology to design the large energy storage solutions. In terms of LCOE, Cumulus Energy Storage is positioned at $180/MWh. They claim that the battery is ideally suited for stationary bulk energy storage applications with a 4-6 hour charge and 4-6 hour discharge cycle where energy density is not an issue. Applications include commercial renewable electricity generation time-shifting, infrastructure security of supply (including off-grid) and energy intensive industry energy management.

column4: Wondrwall offers a series of smart lighting products for applications in residential buildings. These devices convert the home to a network of more than 100 sensors for automatically controlling heating and lighting, while microphones and speakers have been included, allowing users to change the settings using their voice, through Amazon Alexa and play music through Sonos. It also leverages individual motion sensors to work out which rooms are occupied. If one room is used, the temperature sensor of that room is used as the reference point for the entire home. If multiple rooms are occupied, an average of those sensors is used. The company claims that the system employs ML to understand more about the way the owner uses their house. It works in integration with a companion application that is compatible with both Android and iOS devices.

column4: MiDo provides plug & play IoT-enabled flow metering system for the remote monitoring of water, gas & heat. The system consists of a submersible pressure sensor and sealed transducer; dataloggers which collects flow data from sensors, pressure level and communicates data through a GPRS module to cloud network; wireless pressure & analog data transmitter. The cloud network analyzes the collected data to detect a real-time loss in flow mass, billing on real-time consumption, optimize network pressure, and to calculate water & energy balance. Claims to have installed products for monitoring 5k-kilometers of the supply network and registered 20-million readings. column4: GridSingularity facilitates an Internet-based decentralized energy data management and exchange platform built on blockchain technology. GridSingularity accommodates a range of energy market participants, from regulators to operators, investors, traders and consumers. The new platform supports forecasting for grid balancing (smart grid management), facilitate investment, trade of green certificates/certificates of origin and energy trade validation. By recording the relevant data in real time at the source (power plant) on the blockchain, the proposed system diminishes the counterparty risk since data can no longer be modified, while decentralized storage ensures that the data generator has exclusive access to own data. The data recording process is to be certified by the respective energy regulators to validate arbitration. The main advantage of the platform lies in its interoperability,

column4: Nomoko has developed a solution to interact and build applications on top of the digital twin of the world. column4: Nostromo has designed and developed a new integrated thermal energy storage system called "ICE BREAK" which is claimed to be 50% more cost-effective than the traditional ones. This system uses the surplus power generated during the excess periods to store the cold thermal energy in the form of ice. The stored cold thermal energy which is the form of ice will then be used during peak hours by cooling. The company claims to deploy this system for testing by the end of 2017 and if successful, it will be deployed in 2019 for commercial use.

column4: ElectrIQ Power delivers utility bill savings to commercial customers through an integrated solution of cloud-based predictive software and advanced energy storage. ElectrIQ system comprises three basic elements, an energy meter, lithium-ion battery storage, and an inverter. The device has the capability to understand device consumption parameters and suggest improvements and predictive maintenance alerts. The system comes with a cloud-hosted dashboard to monitor and actively manage power consuming units in the household. IQ system can be connected to either rooftop plants (solar/wind/other renewables) or to the grid for backup power support. The stored power can be used in-house or can also be sold back to the grid.

Their technology combines new-age synthetic biology and traditional chemical catalysis to produce a portfolio of bio-based chemicals with large application potentials. From drop-in commodity chemicals, to innovative specialty chemical offerings.

column4: Provider of chemical reactor technology to converts gases into liquid fuels
column5: INERATEC is the provider of a synthetic fuel made from biogenic CO2 and renewable hydrogen. Their Gas-to-Liquid process converts associated natural gas, flared gas or renewable gas into synthetic hydrocarbons and fuels. And with their Power-to-Gas process, synthetic natural gas is produced from hydrogen as well as from carbon dioxide and carbon monoxide. Finally, their Power-to-Liquid process converts renewable electricity and carbon dioxide into liquid, versatile applicable fuels, and chemical feedstocks.

column4: Provider of solutions for carbon capture
column5: Earthy Labs offers a unique product portfolio used in every phase of the liquid gas supply chain, including upfront engineering, service and repair. Chart Industries is a leading global manufacturer of highly engineered equipment servicing multiple applications in the clean energy and industrial gas markets.

column4: Provider of solutions for hydrogen generation and carbon sequestration
column5: Susteon enables disruptive innovations in H2 production and CO2 capture and utilization. They deploy low-carbon solutions for solving real-world problems using deep technology and expertise in hydrogen and carbon dioxide domains. With a strong network and experienc with academia, industry, government, and investment communities, they facilitate public-private partnerships to translate promising scientific discoveries into commercially deployable technologies.

column4: Provider of carbon capture estimation services using satellites and AI technology
column5: Provider of carbon capture estimation services using satellites and AI technology, offering an end-to-end solution where farmers ar enot only able to grow more with less and incrase soil carbon, but also get paid for making a positive impact on reducing climate change, through carbon credits.

column4: Provider of modular carbon capture & recycling services
column5: Hyperion Global Energy provides indsutrial carbon recycling solutions: they capture and convert waste CO2 emissions into some of the world's most sought after mineral commodities. They provide the first of its kind all-in-one capture and conversion drop-in system. The "Tandem Carbon recycling system" is housed in a modular, containerized drop-in unit, designed to capture and convert stack emissions directly at the source. Their proprietary process is net carbon negative, efficiently utilizing high volumes of heavy industry emissions - produced by power generation or other industrial processes such as cement and manufacturing - to create valuable materials and revenue streams.

column4: Provider of solutions to transform atmospheric CO2 into carbonates
column5: Carbix transforms CO2 emissions into building materials. Their focus is on developing and scaling climate technologies. They use point source and direct air capture CO2 emissions to create products, and in the process seek to reduce or eliminate emissions from a wide range of industry sectors like cement, steel, chemicals, and glass. They are also developing reactor arrays to harness CO2 from emission streams generated by Waste to Energy Platns, GeoThermal Plants, Water Desalination and Natural Gas Plants. Their reactors that convert CO2 into products are powered by renewable energy.

column4: Provider of carbon dioxide recycling services
column5: Dimensional Energy transforms carbon dioxide into sustainable aviation fuel. By 2029, their goal is to produce 1,000+ barrels per day (42,000 gallons) to fuel global air travel, and recent investment with United Airlines is accelerating this timeline. By replacing fossil fuels with Dimensional Energy, they can place 11% of global emissions into an industrial use cycle, accounting to 4.4 billion tons per year, or about 2 tons per person from industrialized countries.

column4: Provider of solutions to capture carbon dioxide from atmosphere
column5: Heirloom provides solutions to capture carbon dioxide from the atmosphere. Their technology enhances the natural process of carbon mineralization to help minerals absorb CO2 from the ambient air in days, rather than years, while offering a cost-effective and scalable direct air capture solution.

column4: Provides carbon capture solutions
column5: Verdox provides carbon capture solutions. Using only electriciy , their technology platform can remove carbon dioxide both directly from the air and from emission sources. This means they can flexibly help their partners achieve their climate targets in the most affordable way. They also capture carbon dioxide from the air for those seeking to turn it into useful products. Their technology approach is agnostic to the CO2 concentration of the source gas, allowing them to efficiently capture CO2 not only from industrial sources, but also from the air. Additionally, the electrochemical nature enables their systems to run entirely on renewable electricity and avoid further emissions.

column4: Provider of biotechnology-based carbon storage solutions
column5: Living Carbon provides biotechnology-based carbon storage solutions. It is a public benefit corporation with a mission to rebalance th emetabolic system of our planet. They have developed a proof of concept photosynthesis-enhanced seedling, by combine advanced biotechnology with the inherent power of plants to sequester and store carbon, and are working on scaling their production lab and commercialize their technology.

column4: Provider of carbon capture and sequestration solutions
column5: Blue Planet Systems developed a patented mineralization technology that is the only known scalable method for capturing and permanently sequestering billions of tonnes of CO2. Their process can use dilute CO2 from any source, at any concentration, and turn it into valuable building materials to enable carbon capture at a profit. Each tonne of their aggregate permanently mineralizes 440kgs of CO2, preventing it from ever leaking or accumulating in the atmosphere. If we replace 16% of all aggregate used today with Blue Planet Aggregate, we could achieve the Co2 storage needed by 2050 to keep temperature rise below 1.5C.

column4: Developer of a new chemistry to low-cost direct air capture (DAC) of carbon dioxide
column5: Mission Zero is scaling a low-energy, heat-free technology for Direct Air Capture of CO2. Their technology recovers high-purity CO2 from the air while incurring only a fraction of the costs and energy it takes to do with current methods. They have developed a process that captures CO2 in its organic form, coupled with an ion-selective electrochemical separation process that continuously and efficiently scrubs CO2 from our air-contacting step and concentrates it as a pure gas.

column4: Developer of carbon capture and sequestration project
column5: Carbon America offers a one-stop solution for Carbon Capture and Sequestration (CCS). They deliver the entire CO2 capture-transport-storage value chain from screening through development, construction, operation and project closure with a commitment ot finding the right solution for emitters, communities, and the environment. They choose from a range of capture technology options, manage the transportation and logistics, research, oversee, optimize and take on the liabilities of secure geologic sequestration sites, and deal with all the critical enabling activities, such as tax equity, permitting, project financing, sequestration site management, and qualification for incentives.

column4: Provider of solutions to capture carbon directly from the air
column5: Sustaera has developed a novel Direct Air Capture technologies which uses renewable energy to remove, replace, and reuse carbon at a massive scale. Their carbon-negative, cost-effective and modular direct air capture system works around the clock in different locations, and can scale-up leveraging existing supply chains. They plan to remove 500 million tons of CO2 by 2040.

column4: Advanced materials for carbon capture from gases
column5: Mosaic Materials is dedicated to reducing the cost and environmental impact of fossil fuels through the application of proprietary, highly efficient gas separation technologies. They utilize porous solids known as metal-organic frameworks to selectively remove impurities sucvh as CO2 from gas mixtures in an array of applications from submarines to power plants. They develop metal-organic frameworks, a class of porous solids suitable for gas separations owing to their large internal surface areas and chemical tunability.  The cooperative-binding technology allows the CO2-loaded materials to be regenerated using only moderate temperature or pressure changes, substantially increasing energy efficiency and decreasing costs.

column4: Provider of solutions to captures the carbon emissions from a semi truck
column5: Remora offers carbon capture solutions for semi-trucks. Their device captures at least 80% of a semi-truck's carbon emissions directly from the tailpipe. They sell all the CO2 to end-users who can store it away for a long time. In the future, they plan to sell credits for injecting it underground. They split that revenue with their customers, so the device pays for itself in just a couple years.

column4: Provider of solutions to capture carbon emissions of ships
column5: Seabound offers solutions to capture CO2 emissions from ships. Ships emits over 1 billion tons of greenhouse gas every year (more than airplines) and the New International Maritime Organization regulations require them to slash CO2 emissions by 40% by 2023. Seabound captures up to 95% of CO2 emissions per ship. An onvoard device traps emissions from a ship's exhaust, thenc aptured Co2 is unloaded when the ship docks, to be sold for utilization or sequestration.

column4: Provider of tech solutions to offset carbon footprints from the ocean and restore the coasts
column5: Running Tide is a global ocean health company that is rebalancing the carbon cycle. They build software-controlled, aquatric growing systems, laden with sensors and machine vision, to grow shellfish and macroalgae from seed to harvest at massive scales. They have a portfolio of products, including: sensors to measure environmental data at many depths in coastal and open-ocean environments, verification systems for growth tracking, modularized growing systems for shellfish and macroalgae, robotic processing and handling systems, and amachine vision for processing at high volumes.

column4: Provider of green hydrogen and carbon capture services
column5: Hago Energetics develops green hydrogen and carbon capture services. Their portfolio of projects include: Green Hydrogen Project, Industrial Carbon Capture, Direct Air Capture Project, Mars CO2 Conversion Project. In August 2021, it win the NASA CO2 conversion challenge award, awarding them with $75,000 to convert carbon dioxide into sugar.

column4: Provider of carbon capture services
column5: Aqualung accelerates CCUS projects by providing cost effective solutions for a wide range of industrial emitters and fuel sources across the spectrum, from natural gas to cement production. After 20 years of dedicated research and testing, the patented membrane technology is ready to be commercialised and rolled out. They are a leader in membrane carbon capture and separation technology to accelerate the decarbonisation of heavy industry and transport.

column4: Provides carbon capturing solutions
column5: CarbonQuest is leading the quest for decarbonization by providing urban biulding owners advanced technologies and solutions that enable acceleration of global reduction now. They have developed a patent pending to perform carbon capture in builidings which in the process of carbon removal, will reduce CO2 emissions. Their solution is economical (required low capex and opex), safe (100% non-flammable), modular (size to building size and thermal load), and measurable (full system monitoring and control of all processes including volume and purity of captured CO2).

column4: Provider of carbon dioxide removal services
column5: Vesta adds carbon-removing sand made of the mineral olivine to coastal protection projects. There, the sand gradually dissolves, countering ocean acidification and permanently removing carbon dioxide from the atmosphere. They are focused on furthering the science of Coastal Carbon Capture and galvanize global deployment.

column4: Mine-mouth generating station offering carbon capture facilities
column5: Project Tundra is a bold initiative to build the world's largest carbon capture facility in North Dakota. Their innovative technology is designed to capture 90% of the CO2 produced from either generator at the Milton R. Young Station, this capture rate amounts to about 4 million metric tons per year, the equivalent to taking 800,000 gasoline-fueled off the road.

column4: Provider of carbon capture solutions
column5: Compact Carbon Capture developed a technology using centrifugal forces to distribute the solvent employed for capturing CO2 - enabling more effective solvent distribution that enahnces mass trasnfer. Designing a carbon capture plant with CCC will reduce its footprint by up to 75% and require lower capital expanditures when compared to carbon capture plants designed using conventional technologies. Thanks to such size reduction, they can provide a modular and scalable carbon capture unit that can easily be deployed into existing brownfield sites and offshore.

column4: Provider of direct air capture-based solutions for air purification
column5: RepAir provides direct air capture solutions, to capture CO2 from the air at Gigaton scale using a unique, ultra-low-cost solution. Their technology is inspired by battery and fuel cell principles, and their innovative electrochemical device utilizes electricity to separate CO2 from the air. RepAir enjoys the support of ESIL, a partnership of EDF Renewables, Johnson Matthey and Bazan Group. ESIL provides a platform for commercializing breakthrough sustainable solutions.

column4: Provides carbon capture and removal using electrochemistry
column5: Ebb Carbon provides carbon capture and removal using electrochemistry. They boost the ocean's natural chemical processes to safely store excess carbon dioxide from the air as bicarbonate, the ocean's most abundant form of natural carbon storage. Their approach uses the ocean's vast surface area to capture and store carbon dioxide, and their technology is built with modular, pre-fabricated elements that easily scale.

column4: Offering solutions to remove the CO2 from atmosphere

They provide access to credit revenue, project financing, inventory and shipment management, consulting and onboarding support, and marketing opportunities.

column5: ViriCiti is a platform designed to help operators manage their entire electric operaton. It offers a cloud-based energy management & analytics solutions provider for electric buses and trucks. Today, they serve some of the largest electric operations in the world, across 20 countries. In August 2021, it got acquired by ChargePoint, a leading EV charging network poerating in North America and Europe, for EUR 75 million.

column4: Provider of carbon capture services
column5: Entropy's proprietary technology, Modular Carbon Capture & Storage, expands carbon market possibilities by offering retrofit solutions to existing emitting facilities. Their process efficiency and carbon capture costs are industry-low , due to Entropy23, a high-performance patent-pending solvent. Emitters can retrofit existing facilities with an MCCS installation or opt for Integrated Carbon Capture (iCCS). Entropy's iCCS compressors utilize carbon capture technology incorporated in the design. To further optimize the Entropy technology suite, waste heat is utilized and recycled (Entropy Heat Capture). Entropy leverages decades of subsurface experience with pre-combustion CO2 storage (Reverse Entropy Storage) resulting in over 500,000 tonnes of abated CO2.

column4: Ubiik provides (AMI) Advanced Metering Infrastructure for electricity monitoring using RFID and LPWAN technologies. The company has developed a device called Weightless which is a narrowband LPWAN gateway offering a long-range connectivity and its firmware can be updated over the air. The device can operate over the whole range of license-exempt sub-GHz ISM/SRD bands and offers an adaptive data rate ranging from 625bps to 100kbps. The company offers a plug and play LPWAN development kit. The company has also developed NFC and UHF-based e-paper tags which offer a read and write range of 10 mm and 50 cm respectively.
